特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
関連科目: ビジネスにおける異文化コンピテンシー／Intercultural Competency in Business
授業方法:
• Utilize a wide variety of approach and experiential and interactive activities during the class and focus on student-driven exploration
• Utilize critical incidents to provide a deeper understanding of the contents
• Work individual, pair or group on topics that relate to context

第1回: Introduction to the course, Why study Intercultural Communication? Simulation activity for intercultural communication and debrief & discussions
第2回: Exercise for “encountering the unfamiliar”, Four Cultural models and define culture, Stereotype and generalization
Read assigned reading and prepare for class discussion
第3回:
Navigating culture shock abroad – Managing cultural transitions, Reverse Culture Shock
Reflection Essay #1: Autobiography - peer review
Read assigned reading and prepare for class discussion.
第4回: Cultural frameworks – Geert Hofstede’s dimensions #1: Individualism vs. Collectivism, Power Distance, Masculinity vs. Femininity
Read assigned reading and prepare for class discussion.
第5回:
Cultural frameworks – Geert Hofstede’s dimensions #2: Uncertainty Avoidance, Long-term vs. Short-term Orientation, Indulgence
Reflection Essay #1: Autobiography - due
Read assigned reading and prepare for class discussion.
第6回: Communication styles: High Context and Low Context, The power of Silence and active listening
Read assigned reading and prepare for class discussion.
第7回:
Non-verbal communication in different cultures, Use of emoticon and emoji in different cultures
Reflection Essay #2: Newspaper Reflection - draft peer review
Read assigned reading and prepare for class discussion.
第8回: Culture focus: Japan (1) – Historical, geographical, and religious influence by comparing with students’ cultures
Read assigned reading and prepare for class discussion.
第9回:
Culture focus: Japan (2) – Cultural core values and mindset by comparing with students’ cultures
Reflection Essay #2: Newspaper Reflection - due
Read assigned reading and prepare for class discussion.
第10回:
Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (D,E,I&B); Managing stereotypes, bias, unconscious bias, and microaggression
Intercultural Contact presentation paper - draft peer review
Read assigned reading and prepare for class discussion.
第11回: Read assigned reading and prepare for class discussion.
第14回:
Summary and reflections of the course
“Developmental Model of Intercultural Sensitivity (DMIS) ”
Intercultural Contact presentation paper - due
Read assigned reading and prepare for class discussion.
